image.altText: A boy smiling and wearing a beanie.

props.synopsis: The driver who crashed into the South Australian police commissioner's youngest son Charlie Stevens did "not immediately break nor decelerate", but turned away "in an effort to avoid hitting him", court documents have revealed.

title.children: Court documents reveal what happened before the hit-and-run crash that killed Charlie Stevens

image.altText: man holding basketball on shoulder

props.synopsis: The Adelaide 36ers basketball team has condemned anonymous racial base directed online at former NBA star Montrezl Harrell, who joined the team last month.

title.children: Former NBA star Montrezl Harrell targeted on social media

image.altText: A boy and his dad smiling together while on a mountain.

props.synopsis: SA's Police Commissioner Grant Stevens and his wife Emma tell a court of their pain after their 'vibrant' and 'fun-loving' son Charlie was killed in a crash while at Schoolies celebrations last year.Â

title.children: Losing youngest son has 'taken so much of the colour out of our lives', SA Police Commissioner tells court

image.altText: Four people wearing yellow vests outside an old building with a blue ribbon across it

props.synopsis: The owner of one of the largest sawmills in Australia is spending millions of dollars on new equipment to turn steam into more than enough electricity to run the plant and possibly electric trucks into the future.

title.children: Sawmill wood waste to turn steam into electricity in return to 1950s

image.altText: Palestinian flags at a pro-Palestine rally.

props.synopsis: Federal and state authorities have urged pro-Palestinian protesters to reconsider plans to hold rallies on the first anniversary of the October 7 terrorist attack, with the SA premier describing a proposed demonstration as "grossly irresponsible" and "insensitive" to the Jewish community.

title.children: 'Grossly irresponsible' for pro-Palestine protests on anniversary of Hamas terrorist attack, SA Premier says

image.altText: A man with grey hair wearing a black jacket in front of an old house with iron lace

props.synopsis: Real estate agents say property tax increases in Victoria mean investment buyers are choosing to purchase houses in South Australia instead.

title.children: Home prices up in South Australia as Victorian investors move across the border to avoid tax hikes

image.altText: A middle-aged indigenous man with curly grey hair smiles at the camera inside his office with indigenous art in background.

props.synopsis: Aboriginal clinician Darryle Barnes is no stranger to attending funerals, with his father and grandfather dying in their early 50s. As he approaches the same age, it is an outcome he is driven to change.

title.children: Darryle was sick of attending funerals so he's changing Indigenous health outcomes one GP visit at a time

image.altText: A mum pushing her daughter on the swing

props.synopsis: The threat of lead contamination is just about everywhere in Port Pirie. It means the burden of protecting children, who are more at risk of poisoning, falls to parents.Â

title.children: Parents raising children near lead smelter fear fight against health impacts is 'a losing battle'

image.altText: 2024-10-03T220058Z_772970726_RC29DAALVLAQ_RTRMADP_3_ISRAEL-PALESTINIANS-LEBANON

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong has released a statement confirming the flights will be free of charge, with vulnerable passengers prioritised. Two government-supported charter flights carrying up to 500 passengers will depart the Lebanese capital Beirut for Cyprus tomorrow.

title.children: Qantas to run two free flights from Cyprus to Sydney to evacuate Australians, foreign minister says

image.altText: An old stone building with a red dome

props.synopsis: A woman found guilty of stealing from elderly victims over an eight-year period has been sentenced to at least five years in jail, with the judge saying the fraudster lacked "contrition" and that she had actually stolen millions more than the $270,000 over which she was charged.

title.children: 'Con artist' who swindled elderly victims of savings jailed over 'web of deceit'

image.altText: People in traditional Indonesian clothes

props.synopsis: Adelaide students have enjoyed a flamboyant exchange program with their sister school near Jakarta for the first time since the 2002 Bali bombings put the program on hold.

title.children: School renews Indonesian cultural exchange 22 years after Bali bombings put it on hold

props.synopsis: Ahmad Sadeghi made remarks on social media late last month, the day Hassan Nasrallah was killed in an Israeli air strike.Â

title.children: Peter Dutton calls for Iranian ambassador to be expelled after tweet praising slain Hezbollah leader

image.altText: Joe Biden looks straight ahead with stern expression, holding one hand in a balled up fist

props.synopsis: The White House has been urged to speed up sharing of sensitive military technology with Australia, agreed under the AUKUS deal, so the nations can jointly develop future weapons.Â

title.children: Biden urged to speed up sensitive military exports to Australia over 'grave and imminent' China threat

image.altText: White sandy beach with tropical palms and blue sky.

props.synopsis: Cocos (Keeling) Island residents are told its local co-operative owes millions of dollars to creditors, putting jobs and supplies at risk.

title.children: Residents of this tropical paradise waiting for answers after major employer goes bust

image.altText: Police officers stand at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Two men have been shot by police in Wentworthville after allegedly driving a stolen vehicle at NSW Police officers.

title.children: Two men shot by police in Sydney's west after allegedly driving stolen car at officers

image.altText: Counsel assisting the commissioner, Philip Urquhart

props.synopsis: One of WA's top youth justice bosses tells an inquest into the death of an Indigenous teenager she has been berated and bullied by coroner Phillip Urquart, and wants Â him to recuse himself from presiding over the inquest. WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.Â

title.children: 'Berated and bullied': High-ranking justice official wants WA coroner removed from Cleveland Dodd inquest

image.altText: Donald Trump does a fist pump.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump likely won't face court again before next month's election but that doesn't mean the wheels aren't still turning on the criminal cases against him.

title.children: Donald Trump and Mike Pence's partnership didn't end well. New court filings allege just how bad it got

image.altText: aerial photo of island with blue water and clouds at the top

props.synopsis: After years of negotiations, the UK is giving up its sovereignty over a cluster of strategically important Indian Ocean islands. The move has led to criticism from Britain's Conservative opposition and some local Indigenous groups.

title.children: This tiny island chain has been under British control since 1814. That changed this week

image.altText: Tech graphic

props.synopsis: Ever received a scam text from Australia Post while you're waiting for a package? Or a fake toll notice after you've driven on a toll road? Experts say data collected by the online advertising industry could be behind it.

title.children: The completely legal trick scammers can exploit to target millions of Australians

image.altText: A close up of a man's face with cuts and bruises.

props.synopsis: Queensland's Liberal National Party has accepted a $17,500 donation from a party official alleged to have assaulted a young Indigenous woman and her husband.

title.children: LNP accepted $17,500 donation from party official being investigated over alleged assault

props.synopsis: X (formerly Twitter) has unsuccessfully challenged Australia's eSafety Commissioner's fine for allegedly failing to respond to questions about harmful content on its platform, particularly child sexual abuse material.

title.children: X Corp loses court challenge to avoid fine over child abuse notice

image.altText: Military personnel dressed in blue march holding Australian flags

props.synopsis: This year's Lowy Institute Asia Power Index ranks Australia as the fifth most influential player in the continent, but its strength may not have grown all that much.

title.children: Australia is now a more 'powerful' nation than Russia. Here's how it ranks in eight key areas

image.altText: Exterior of the District Court of Western Australia on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Karen Salkilld pretended to have died in a car accident and claimed a large insurance payout in the name of her partner, who was not involved in the scam, a court hears.

title.children: Movie inspired woman to fake her own death in car accident and claim $700k insurance payout, court told

image.altText: Michael Rowland moves to hug Tony Armstrong

props.synopsis: Tony Armstrong makes his last appearance as a sports presenter on ABC News Breakfast, describing his time on the program as a "joyride".

title.children: Tony Armstrong hangs up the boots at ABC News Breakfast

image.altText: An empty construction site

props.synopsis: The demise of Quasar Constructions has left an estimated $60 million debt and disrupted critical projects including the Western Sydney International Airport, with subcontractors calling on the federal government to protect the struggling construction industry.Â

title.children: Collapse of high-profile construction company leaves debt and disruption for major projects

image.altText: Man with glasses and wearing a flannelette shirt

props.synopsis: An inquest into death of a man from septic shock at Bunbury Hospital highlights miscommunication and significant backlogs the state's struggling regional health system.

title.children: Coroner flags multiple 'missed opportunities' in WA man's country hospital death

image.altText: A man wearing a black shirt standing next to a woman with her face blurred.

props.synopsis: A 61-year-old man has died on a front lawn in Melbourne's north-west, after allegedly being stabbed by his stepson.

title.children: Melbourne man killed in alleged stabbing 'always looked out' for family

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands at a diplomatic event

props.synopsis: A Cambodian woman working as a maid in Malaysia has been deported to her homeland and subsequently arrested over comments she posted on social media criticising Cambodian government leaders.

title.children: Maid deported by Malaysia to Cambodia for criticising Cambodian leaders

image.altText: A series of photos of someone in a kitchen, taken from ground level

props.synopsis: Without even entering the building, we were able to silently peer through the camera on a Deebot device made by Chinese giant Ecovacs.

title.children: The world's largest home robotics company has a problem â its vacuum cleaners can be hacked from afar

image.altText: A shopping trolley full of essentials items like fruit, water, and eggs

props.synopsis: It's often cheaper to buy private label or "home brand" groceries. But they're also often more profitable for the supermarkets.

title.children: Home brand products are cheaper at the supermarket. But are they good value?

image.altText: A photo of Mike Reynolds sitting in a black suit and looking directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: In the days after WA's first recorded death in juvenile detention, the government sacked its corrective services commissioner, Mike Reynolds. Now, for the first time, he details the chaos behind the scenes during his tenure.

title.children: Sacked corrective services boss lifts lid on troubled youth detention system

image.altText: Erik Menendez (R) and brother Lyle listen to court proceedings during a May 17, 1991 appearance.

props.synopsis: New evidence has emerged that corroborates allegations that Erik Menendez was sexually abused by his father and he and his brother Lyle killed their parents in self-defence.Â

title.children: Prosecutors to review new evidence in Menendez brothers' 1996 murder conviction

image.altText: Garth Brooks at the inauguration of US President Joe Biden

props.synopsis: In a statement, Garth Brooks has denied allegations outlined in the lawsuit saying: "I am not the man they have painted me to be."

title.children: Garth Brooks responds to accusations of rape in lawsuit from hair-and-makeup artist

image.altText: Image of a coal mine from above with what appears to be activity

props.synopsis: A coal mining group with former links to a US fraudster denies claims of illegal mining, and destroying koala habitat without federal approval. Environment groups are doubling down, and want immediate action.

title.children: 'This is illegal coal mining': Koala habitat cleared without federal approval by company previously linked to fraudster
